body: Good catch, do you know how were they updated in the past? I've checked the history and those updates are a part of release PR but it's hard to say if this was a manual or automated edit.

> Good catch, do you know how were they updated in the past? I've checked the history and those updates are a part of release PR but it's hard to say if this was a manual or automated edit.

I suspect, one of these:
https://allcontributors.org/docs/en/tooling

@mloning might know more.
Think it's still manual. I tried installing the bot a few times but couldn't get it to work.

Docs are still here:
https://allcontributors.org/docs/en/cli/installation

>Think it's still manual. 

Do you mean manual, as there is something you can locally and commit - or, manual as in having to translate the all-contributors line by line??

> Do you mean manual, as there is something you can locally and commit - or, manual as in having to translate the all-contributors line by line??

Using their command line client (the link you posted)
hm, looks straighforward enough - so someone should be able to do that locally and simply make a PR with the updated file, until we figure out how to automate it.

issue.title: [DOC] Update CONTRIBUTORS.md

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
#### Reference Issues/PRs
This is a manual update of the CONTRIBUTORS.md since there is currently no automated way (see #2905).

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
Updates the list of contributors in CONTRIBUTORS.md  based on `.all-contributorsrc` with the CLI of [all-contributors](https://github.com/all-contributors/all-contributors).

issue.title: [DOC] Update CONTRIBUTORS.md

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/sktime/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.

Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->
See #2905 for reference.

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->
Locally ran `all-contributors-cli` via npm to update `CONTRIBUTORS.md` to include new changes. The last update was two months ago so I thought it'll be great to have it updated.

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?
None
<!--
If your contribution does add a new hard dependency, we may suggest to initially develop your contribution in a separate companion package in https://github.com/sktime/ to keep external dependencies of the core sktime package to a minimum.
-->

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?

<!-- This section is particularly useful if you have a pull request that is still in development. You can guide the reviews to focus on the parts that are ready for their comments. We suggest using bullets (indicated by * or -) and filled checkboxes [x] here -->

#### Any other comments?
<!--
Please be aware that we are a loose team of volunteers so patience is necessary; assistance handling other issues is very welcome. We value all user contributions, no matter how minor they are. If we are slow to review, either the pull request needs some benchmarking, tinkering, convincing, etc. or more likely the reviewers are simply busy. In either case, we ask for your understanding during the review process.
-->

#### PR checklist
<!--
Please go through the checklist below. Please feel free to remove points if they are not applicable.
-->

##### For all contributions
- [ ] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [ ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [ ] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.
- [x] The PR title starts with either [ENH], [MNT], [DOC], or [BUG] indicating whether the PR topic is related to enhancement, maintenance, documentation, or bug.

<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->

body: I think the most direct solution will be to have a GitHub bot perform this operation whenever it notices a change in `.all_contributorsrc`. There's already a [bot](https://allcontributors.org/docs/en/bot/overview) that they provide but even that requires a cue to perform a PR so we might as well create one for added flexibility.

issue.title: [MNT] Automate updating CONTRIBUTORS.md

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/sktime/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.

Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->
Fixes #2905

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->
Add a GH workflow that is triggered when changes are made to `.all-contributorsrc` in a PR. This works by setting up the environment and calling `all-contributors-cli generate` followed by making an automatic commit to reflect the changes in `CONTRIBUTORS.md`.

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?

<!--
If your contribution does add a new hard dependency, we may suggest to initially develop your contribution in a separate companion package in https://github.com/sktime/ to keep external dependencies of the core sktime package to a minimum.
-->
None

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?

<!-- This section is particularly useful if you have a pull request that is still in development. You can guide the reviews to focus on the parts that are ready for their comments. We suggest using bullets (indicated by * or -) and filled checkboxes [x] here -->
- Location of this workflow (Does it make sense to add it in a different file as opposed to already existing workflows)
- Is this the most cost-effective way to implement it? (despite being free we do not want any workflow to needlessly run and waste computation)

#### Any other comments?
<!--
Please be aware that we are a loose team of volunteers so patience is necessary; assistance handling other issues is very welcome. We value all user contributions, no matter how minor they are. If we are slow to review, either the pull request needs some benchmarking, tinkering, convincing, etc. or more likely the reviewers are simply busy. In either case, we ask for your understanding during the review process.
-->

#### PR checklist
<!--
Please go through the checklist below. Please feel free to remove points if they are not applicable.
-->

##### For all contributions
- [x] The PR title starts with either [ENH], [MNT], [DOC], or [BUG] indicating whether the PR topic is related to enhancement, maintenance, documentation, or bug.

<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->

issue.title: Fix automated Contributors.md update

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
@achieveordie has been doing some really helpful work on automating the contributors.md update.

Looks like he ran into a problem. Just opening an issue for us to track the solution. 

His original comment is below:

Whoops, it currently fails with the following:
```
[main 46fc2ca] [AUTOMATED] update CONTRIBUTORS.md
 Author: achieveordie <achieveordie@users.noreply.github.com>
 1 file changed, 53 insertions(+), 33 deletions(-)
INPUT_TAGGING_MESSAGE: 
No tagging message supplied. No tag will be added.
INPUT_PUSH_OPTIONS: 
remote: error: GH006: Protected branch update failed for refs/heads/main.        
remote: error: At least 1 approving review is required by reviewers with write access. 17 of 17 required status checks are expected.        
To https://github.com/sktime/sktime
 ! [remote rejected] main -> main (protected branch hook declined)
error: failed to push some refs to 'https://github.com/sktime/sktime'
```

__Originally posted by @achieveordie in https://github.com/sktime/sktime/pull/3807#issuecomment-1382086216__
